ing: 2 cups wheat bran cereal (such as Kellogg'sÂ® All-BranÂ®)
4 cups bran flakes cereal (such as Kellogg'sÂ®)
des: "These are so great to make ahead and keep in the fridge for up to 2 months. They make a quick breakfast."
ins:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a muffin pan or line with muffin cups.
Pour boiling water over wheat bran cereal in a heat-proof bowl; set aside while cereal softens.
Beat eggs, sugar, and shortening together in a large bowl using an electric mixer until combined.
Sift flour, baking soda, and salt into a bowl. Add flour mixture and buttermilk in an alternating fashion to eggs-sugar mixture. Stir in bran flakes; mix well until batter is smooth.
Spoon batter evenly into prepared muffin pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 15 minutes.
